meanings.definition: A sudden and forceful tackle made by a defensive player in football.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the defender executed a powerful crackback to stop the running back.
meanings.sent2: The crackback by the linebacker prevented a touchdown.
meanings.sent3: The crackback tackle was so strong, it made the crowd cheer loudly.
meanings.sent4: His crackback hit on the opponent was like a brick wall coming out of nowhere.
meanings.sent5: The crackback tackle left a lasting impression on the offensive player.

meanings.definition: To block or tackle an opponent in football by moving in the opposite direction of the initial play.
meanings.sent1: The defensive player tried to crackback the running back to stop his advance.
meanings.sent2: He crackbacked the opponent just in time to prevent a touchdown.
meanings.sent3: The player's quick crackback move surprised everyone on the field.
meanings.sent4: She crackbacked the receiver with such speed, it was like a lightning strike.
meanings.sent5: Crackbacking the opponent was the key to winning the game.

meanings.definition: A type of block in football where a player moves back towards the ball carrier to make a block.
meanings.sent1: The offensive lineman's crackback allowed the quarterback to make a successful pass.
meanings.sent2: The crackback by the wide receiver opened up a clear path for the running back.
meanings.sent3: The crackback block was so well-timed, it looked like a choreographed dance move.
meanings.sent4: His crackback block was like a shield protecting the ball carrier.
meanings.sent5: The crackback maneuver completely surprised the opposing team.
